meanings.definition: A person who tries to influence legislation on behalf of a special interest group.
meanings.sent1: The lobbyists met with lawmakers to discuss the new bill.
meanings.sent2: Many lobbyists work in the capital to advocate for different causes.
meanings.sent3: The lobbyists joked that they could talk about laws in their sleep.
meanings.sent4: In the world of politics, lobbyists are the chess pieces moving the game.
meanings.sent5: The image of lobbyists in suits and ties is a common sight in government buildings.

meanings.definition: The act of attempting to influence legislation on behalf of a special interest group.
meanings.sent1: The success of the lobbyists' efforts was evident in the new law passed.
meanings.sent2: Lobbyists play a crucial role in shaping policies that affect society.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, the lobbyists used persuasive arguments to make their case.
meanings.sent4: The impact of lobbyists on decision-making processes cannot be underestimated.
meanings.sent5: The art of lobbying requires skillful negotiation and communication strategies.
